title: Financial Health Check-Up (10-question Yes/No) with scoring results, WhatsApp contact, and branded theme

requirements.summary: Build a responsive Financial Health Check-Up questionnaire view with exactly 10 fixed questions and Yes/No-only answers, with submit disabled until complete.
acceptanceCriteria: The page displays all 10 questions exactly as provided by the user.
Each question can be answered only with Yes or No (e.g., radio buttons, toggle, segmented control).
A Submit (or equivalent) action is available and is disabled until all 10 questions are answered.
The page layout is responsive (mobile + desktop) and looks professional.

file_operations.description: Create the questionnaire page component that renders the 10 provided questions from a local constant list, enforces Yes/No-only selection per question, tracks completion state, and disables submit until all 10 answers are selected. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, RadioGroup or equivalent) to present a professional UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the app shell that wires navigation to the questionnaire view as the default view and ensures the questionnaire page is reachable on initial load (no orphan page). Use shadcn-ui components for navigation elements where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add scoring (Yes count) and show results immediately after submit using the specified inclusive bands, allowing re-submission after changes.
acceptanceCriteria: After submitting, the UI shows the total Yes count out of 10.
The UI shows exactly one of the four result labels based on the score band.
The boundary overlap in the user text is resolved so that 0–5 maps to Critical Zone and 6–7 maps to Need to review your financial plan (no ambiguous outcomes).
The user can change answers and re-submit to get an updated result (or the result updates live).

file_operations.description: Implement scoring logic that counts total Yes answers (0–10) and maps to exactly one label using these bands: 0–5 Critical Zone; 6–7 Need to review your financial plan; 8–9 Good; 10 Secure. Display 'Your score: X/10' and the band label after submit, and allow users to change answers and re-submit (or update results live) without refresh. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Alert/Badge/Card) for results presentation; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a Contact page/section reachable from the questionnaire that offers financial health review and a WhatsApp 'Contact Now' button to +91 88299 21156.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a visible way to reach the Contact page/section from the main questionnaire page (e.g., top nav link/button).
The Contact Now button opens WhatsApp using a link targeting phone number 918829921156 (e.g., https://wa.me/918829921156).
The Contact page/section contains clear English copy indicating the user can request a review of their financial health.

file_operations.description: Create a dedicated Contact view containing clear English copy offering a review of the user's financial health by the app owner and a primary 'Contact Now' button linking to https://wa.me/918829921156. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button) for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the Contact view into app navigation from the main questionnaire view (e.g., header nav link/button) so it is clearly reachable. Use shadcn-ui components for navigation controls where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply branding assets: background image behind main layout and Axis Max Life logo in the UI, using locally served static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: The Financial Health Check-Up page uses a background image asset (served from frontend/public/assets/generated) and remains readable (overlay/blur/tint as needed).
An Axis Max Life logo image is displayed prominently and does not distort (keeps aspect ratio).
No image assets are fetched from the backend; they are served as static files from the frontend.

file_operations.description: Add the provided generated background image asset at this exact path so it can be served statically by the frontend build.
Add the provided generated Axis Max Life logo asset at this exact path so it can be served statically by the frontend build.

Create a shared layout wrapper that applies the background image from frontend/public/assets/generated/financial-health-bg.dim_1920x1080.png behind the main content (with readability overlay) and renders the logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/axis-max-life-logo.dim_600x200.png in a header area with preserved aspect ratio. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Container/Card) to structure the layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wrap the questionnaire and contact views with BrandedLayout so the background and logo appear consistently across the required screens (no backend image fetching).

requirements.summary: Define and apply a consistent professional finance/insurance theme across questionnaire, results, and contact views, avoiding a blue+purple primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent theme is applied across all screens (questionnaire, results, contact).
The chosen primary palette is not blue+purple.
UI components (buttons, cards, inputs) look cohesive and professional on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn styling) and base typography/spacing defaults for a professional finance/insurance look, ensuring the primary palette is not a blue+purple combination. Keep styling compatible with shadcn-ui conventions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (if needed) to support the chosen non-blue+purple brand palette and consistent typography/spacing across the app while continuing to use the existing CSS-variable-based color system.

Ensure the questionnaire + results sections use the shared theme (cards, button hierarchy, spacing, and typography) and remain polished on mobile and desktop using shadcn-ui building blocks; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the contact view matches the same theme (typography, card styling, CTA button styling) as the questionnaire/results for a coherent professional experience using shadcn-ui components; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
